no_more_50_words: A police officer reports his work by filing a case.
150_to_200_words:
A police officer typically must report their work in a case in order to document and provide evidence for any action taken. They must detail the situation and provide a narrative of the events that occurred. This includes the details of the suspect, any witnesses, and any evidence collected. The report should also include any information about the victim, suspect, or witnesses that was obtained. Additionally, the report should include any notes on the officer’s own observations and any actions taken to complete the case. It is important to provide an accurate and objective account of the situation so that the report can be used as evidence in court if necessary. 

The report should be written in a professional and clear manner in order to ensure that the information is understood and properly recorded. The police officer should also include any additional information that they believe may be pertinent to the case. This could include information on the suspect's criminal history, any prior convictions, or any other details that could help the court make an informed decision. It is important for the report to be complete, accurate, and concise in order to provide an accurate picture of the situation.
